headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE QUAKER CITY.; AFFAIRS IN HAVANA. IMPORTANT MEXICAN INTELLIGENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail Steamship Quaker City, R. W. SCHUFELDT commanding, from Havana in three days and seventeen hours, arrived at this port last evening. She brings 103 passengers. The Quaker City left Havana on Monday, the 8th instant, at 5 P. M., meeting the steamer Granada, from New-Orleans entering the port. The Granada was expected to leave for New-York on the 9th.

docs.snippet: THE TWELFTH REGIMENT TROUBLES--The Joint Committee of the Common Council appointed to memorialize the Governor in favor of reinstating the Twelfth Regiment had a meeting yesterday afternoon, Councilmen LAIMBEER, LENT and VAN TINE were present. A...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE TWELFTH REGIMENT TROUBLES--The Joint Committee of the Common Council appointed to memorialize the Governor in favor of reinstating the Twelfth Regiment had a meeting yesterday afternoon, Councilmen LAIMBEER, LENT and VAN TINE were present. A large number of members of the regiment were also in attendance. Mr. DALRYMPLE introduced Capt. BOYLE, who has belonged to the regiment since its organization, and Capt. HUSON.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: None of the "premonitory symptoms" which Mr. BOONE, in his letter of the 8th inst., to the Health Officer, adduces as "presaging" disease here, is so strong as the present foul state of the Croton water. For some...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: None of the "premonitory symptoms" which Mr. BOONE, in his letter of the 8th inst., to the Health Officer, adduces as "presaging" disease here, is so strong as the present foul state of the Croton water. For some time past the water has had a very disagreeable earthy flavor. Sometimes it tastes as if impregnated with putrid matter and is nauseating.

docs.snippet: By the Interception of the steamship city of Baltimore off Cape race, By the News Yacht of the Associated Press, we receive European advises five days later than those by the Arabia. The City of Baltimore left Liverpool on the 3rd inst., and...
docs.lead_paragraph: By the Interception of the steamship city of Baltimore off Cape race, By the News Yacht of the Associated Press, we receive European advises five days later than those by the Arabia. The City of Baltimore left Liverpool on the 3rd inst., and Queenstown is of amore pacific character ,

headline.main: COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION.; Quarantine Matters Discussed.

docs.lead_paragraph: FRACDS ON EMIGRANTS--WEEKLY STATEMENT, ETC The Commissioners held their weekly session yesterday. From the statement it appears that 93: emigrants arrived at this port during the week ending the 10th instant, making a total for the year of 47,901 against 50,367 to the same date in 1858. There art 730inmates in the Ward's Island Institutiuns, and none in the Marine Hospital.

docs.snippet: Our knowledge of the laws and principles of hygiene as regards dietetics, ventilation and sanitary regulations, has not yet been reduced to an acknowledged science. But most of all in what is called Physical Culture, does ignorance prevail.
docs.lead_paragraph: Our knowledge of the laws and principles of hygiene as regards dietetics, ventilation and sanitary regulations, has not yet been reduced to an acknowledged science. But most of all in what is called Physical Culture, does ignorance prevail.

docs.snippet: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH.-An adjourned meeting of this Board was held yesterday. Several nuisances were reported and ordered abated, The following was also presented and adopted. Whereas, The Board of Health Committee of the Port of New-York, on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH.-An adjourned meeting of this Board was held yesterday. Several nuisances were reported and ordered abated, The following was also presented and adopted. Whereas, The Board of Health Committee of the Port of New-York, on the 20th gay of May, 1859.

docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--At the meeting of the Commissioners of Health yesterday, a communication was received from the Brooklyn Board of Health, thanking the New-York Board for their courtesy in inviting them to sit with them at their regular...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF HEALTH.--At the meeting of the Commissioners of Health yesterday, a communication was received from the Brooklyn Board of Health, thanking the New-York Board for their courtesy in inviting them to sit with them at their regular meetings.

docs.snippet: The Royal Mail steamship Arabia, Capt. STONE, from Liverpool at 10 o' clock on the morning of the 30th ult., arrived at Halifax at 21/2 P.M. yesterday, and the horse express reached here with her news at an early hour this morning.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FORM EUROPE.; Later from India, China and Australia. REPUBLICAN CONSPIRACY IN SPAIN. Cotton Advanced-Breadstuffs Dull-Provisions Declining. CONSOLS 94 7-8 @ 95 3-8. Movement in Favor of Annexing Tuscany to Piedmont. CONDITION OF AFFAIRS IN ITALY. The Peace Conference Not Yet Assembled. ARRIVAL OF THE ARABIA. The French Army and Navy to be Placed Upon a Peace Footing. England Undecided Whether to Enter a General Congress. Projected Reforms in the Internal Policy of Austria. Lord John Russell's Statement Relative to Foreign Affairs. BRITISH PARLIAMENTARY PROCEEDINGS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Arabia, Capt. STONE, from Liverpool at 10 o' clock on the morning of the 30th ult., arrived at Halifax at 21/2 P.M. yesterday, and the horse express reached here with her news at an early hour this morning.

docs.snippet: Nearly all the foreign Ministers have left for the North. Barom STOKCEL and Viscount FREILLARD left for Newport yesterday. Senor MOLINA is in New-York, Senor MATA remains here. Letters from the Count SAETIGES, report his health still feeble.

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; Movements of the Diplomatic Corps--Count Sartiges--Appointment. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly all the foreign Ministers have left for the North. Barom STOKCEL and Viscount FREILLARD left for Newport yesterday. Senor MOLINA is in New-York, Senor MATA remains here. Letters from the Count SAETIGES, report his health still feeble.
